main_definition: Norton can refer to a brand of computer security software or be used as an idiom, depending on the context.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A family name associated with Bill Norton, a former American businessman and politician.
meanings_and_examples.example: Bill Norton served as Secretary of Commerce under President Ronald Reagan.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiom meaning to provide extensive assistance or support in resolving an issue, often used metaphorically.
meanings_and_examples.example: When the IT team called their favorite computer security software 'Norton,' it was because they knew Norton could offer them comprehensive help with their system problems.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The name of a well-known brand of antivirus and anti-malware software.
meanings_and_examples.example: After downloading the latest update, I ran a full scan using my Norton Antivirus to ensure no malicious programs were on my computer.
